comment.realname: lifeasdaddy ...a guy, his wife, and their son...
comment.author: 13267298@N00
comment._content: On September 13, 1913, Prince Albert 1 of Monaco passed through Chicago on his way to Cody, Wyoming to meet Colonel William F. Cody ".... to start on a two-month hunt in the Rockies." according to the NYT of September 14, 1913: query.nytimes.com/mem/archive-free/pdf?_r=1&res=9402E... F. J. Hiscock was a prominent photographer of Cody, Wyoming: forum.treasurenet.com/index.php?topic=164820.0

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content: Info from "Cody Pictures" website: www.wyomingtalesandtrails.com/cody5.html----------- "Joseph Jesse Faver "Fay Jay" Hiscock (F. J. Hiscock) (1874-1951), was originally from Kalamazoo, Michigan. He remained active in photography in Cody from his arrival in 1904 until the early 1940's, and sold packages of photographs to tourists. The packages were primarily of the Cody Road. In his advertising he referred to himself as 'The Picture Man.'"

comment.author: 35072786@N08
comment._content: Thank you BobMeade and Wystan for your addition information about Prince Albert's visit  with Bill Cody.  We will add some of it to the description.
